intro: Badula paludosa, commonly known as the marsh badula, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in temperate regions. It typically grows in moist, nutrient-poor soils, often found in bogs and marshes. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves that are usually丛生 (clumped) at the base. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically greenish or brownish and appear in early spring. Badula paludosa plays an important role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
